intro: Ulex genistoides var. spectabilis, commonly known as the yellow whitlow grass, is a flowering plant native to western Europe. It is a low-growing perennial that produces clusters of bright yellow flowers in early spring. The plant has small, needle-like leaves and is often found in sandy or coastal soils. It is characterized by its distinctive, showy blooms that attract pollinators. The species is part of the Fabaceae family, known for its nitrogen-fixing capabilities.
